page.title: 02Schools in Barton
page.content:
In the village of Barton there are two denominational primary schools situated about one mile apart. There is also a County Primary school in Catforth. Although the overall population is fairly stable, the number of children has decreased considerably in the past ten years with the result that the Local Education Authority has considered the Church of England school for closure. The C of E authorities have countered with proposals for amalgamating the R.C. school with their own. This resulted in much local discussion and the formation of action committees during 1984.
Although the proposals have been shelved for the present there is still concern that the area may lose one or more of its schools during this decade.
